meanings.definition: An event, especially a sports game, that is canceled or postponed due to rain.
meanings.sent1: The baseball game was a rainout, so we had to reschedule it.
meanings.sent2: The soccer match was declared a rainout because of the heavy downpour.
meanings.sent3: The rainout turned our outdoor picnic into an indoor party instead.
meanings.sent4: The sudden storm was a rainout for our plans to go hiking in the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The disappointment of a rainout lingered as we watched the storm pass by.

meanings.definition: The act of canceling or postponing an event, especially a sports game, due to rain.
meanings.sent1: The coach's decision to declare a rainout was met with mixed reactions from the team.
meanings.sent2: The rainout announcement came just as the players were getting ready for the match.
meanings.sent3: The rainout led to an unexpected day off for the players, much to their delight.
meanings.sent4: The rainout was a blessing in disguise as it gave the team more time to practice.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation of a rainout grew as dark clouds gathered over the stadium.
